story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

This page has been set up in loving memory of our dear friend and colleague Garth Martin who sadly gained his angel wings on 25th November 2020. Garth was the most caring, supportive, hardworking, wittiest, selfless person you could ever hope to meet. His optimism and zest for life was inspiring. He received the devastating news of his cancer diagnosis on 30th January 2020 and was determined that this was not going to define who he was, and it didn't. His courage and wisdom was awe inspiring. It is often said that many people will walk in and out of your life but very few will leave footprints on your heart. Well Garth left footprints on all of our hearts and in his memory we have chosen to donate to Macmillan Cancer Support whom were of great comfort and support to him throughout his illness. 

The work that this charity does is amazing; they are angels in disguise and Garth would be thrilled to know that in his memory we are helping to support their amazing work.

Thank you to each and every one of you. 

Keep on dancing my friend! Gone but never forgotten.

story:
On Friday 27 November, Rod Moreton passed away peacefully at the home he shared with his wife of 25 years, Viv. 

A much-loved husband, father and grandfather, he was an incredibly funny and smart individual who always had a quick-witted line for any situation.

Rod had been cared for at home for several years, having been previously seriously injured in a car accident back in 2000. Despite the many challenges this caused him, both physically and mentally, he never lost his unique character. Those that cared for him in recent times couldn’t fail to become fond of his warm heart and humble ways.

Over the years, anyone that knew him was well aware of his deep passion for music – not just listening but singing too in his own inimitable style! He enjoyed classic TV comedies, and his unique laugh could be heard echoing around the house.

A big football fan, he was a devoted follower of Wolverhampton Wanderers and particularly star striker Steve Bull, and had many happy years looking after his beloved Irish wolfhounds.

He was incredibly active in his younger days playing sport and would go on to enjoy many holidays with Viv, while working as a care assistant at South Ockendon hospital and later in the community for the NHS. Brother to Harry, Brenda and Kay, father to Adam and Samantha, and grandfather to Tayla, Rod also had two step-daughters in Nicola and Tara.

The family will say their goodbyes to Rod on Wednesday 16 December at Basildon crematorium. We kindly ask that you do not buy flowers but any donations to Macmillan Cancer Support would be very gratefully received.

story:
Hello everyone! 

For those of you who know me, you'll know I have a big love of games. I recently saw a friend doing this for charity and saw this as a great opportunity to raise some money for a great cause by doing something I love (maybe not by the end of the 24hours).

For a little context, my Grandfather was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer little under a year ago. He's still fighting, and being awesome, but I just wanted to do something to show my support to him as well as others still fighting Cancer and those we've lost.

I will be streaming one of my favourite games on Twitch for 24 hours starting on the 28/12 @1800.

 My username is Symbolicwolf87 and I would love it if you could join me for some of this to show some support for such a great charity.

Thank you for any support/donations you can give.

Bradley

story: Welcome to my Just Giving fundraising page! I am running the 2021 Edinburgh Marathon for British Heart Foundation in order to raise as much money as possible to beat heartbreak forever. Thanks for visiting my page. I decided to run a marathon and said why not do it for a great cause and enjoy a run! Having lost my grandmother to vuscular dimentia this year, I know first hand the pain of loss. I'm raising money for the British heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

story:
I am supporting Pygott & Crone to raise funds for the BHF by undertaking the Go The Distance - 100 km challenge. The task: to run or walk 100 km between Boxing Day 2020 and the end of January 2021.

Eight years ago we sadly lost a 'super fit' work colleague, David Neal, to a heart attack. Following David's passing the 'Telegraph 10' raised over £3,000 for the BHF by walking up Mount Snowdon in David's memory. David was a keen mountaineer and Snowdon was his favourite mountain in the UK. 

When Kevin asked me to support this challenge to raise funds for the BHF it was an instant yes to help such a great charity and once again do something in David's memory.

story:
Thanks for visiting our page. We're raising money for the British Heart Foundation and we'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. 

INFO ABOUT MACS DUO AND THE EVENT!

Off the back of our Twisted Lockdown Quizzes, MaCs Duo - the contemporary jazz and blues singing partnership based in Norwich, wanted to end the year with something special as a thank you to everyone who has supported them in this difficult year. They will be going live from 8:30pm on Friday 18th December on Facebook and YouTube with Christmas songs, stories, good cheer, and of course - a mini Twisted Quiz! 

This show is supporting the British Heart Foundation (BHF) and the vital, life-saving research they do into heart and cardiovascular disease. Both Martin and Cat of MaCs have been affected by the loss and illness of loved ones due to heart disease and stroke, and they couldn't be more thrilled to be supporting such a wonderful cause.

story:
The 12 Guide Dogs of Christmas Collection

Help us as we aim to raise enough to support 12 brand new guide dogs this Christmas!

During December the four-legged volunteers of the Scotland Fundraising Group would usually be out and about wagging their tails and meeting you at collections and events in your community. 

Due to the current situation, we’re not able to be out as much this
festive season, and we know you will miss seeing our life-changing doggy volunteers! We’re hoping you will help us and donate to our ‘12 Guide Dogs of Christmas’ Collection as we aim to raise enough for 12 new guide dog partnerships! 

It costs over £56,000 to fund the lifetime cost of a guide dog. Please consider donating £12 during our 12-day collection so we can fund 12 new life-changers this Christmas. 

We appreciate that times are difficult, but for people with sight loss,
social isolation can be their everyday. You can help them feel less alone, now and in the future.

Don’t forget to send it on through Facebook, WhatsApp, email or text and get your friends and family involved too.

Thank you and Merry Christmas!

story:
We want to raise as much as possible for GOSH, as this charity means so much to us, as a company we have a long history of supporting them. Now, is no different and we want to ensure we continue to raise these valuable funds.

Whitbread has supported GOSH Charity as its national charity partner since 2012. Premier Inn & Restaurants team members, guests and suppliers across the country raised £7.5 million towards the Premier Inn Clinical Building, a seven-floor facility with spacious inpatient wards and state-of-the-art operating theatres, which was officially opened in January 2018.

In 2017 Whitbread committed to continue the partnership with GOSH Charity and raise a further £10 million towards a new Sight and Sound Centre at the Hospital.

When it opens in 2020 the new centre will be the UK’s first dedicated medical facility for children with sight and hearing loss. In one dedicated building, the centre will house specialist outpatient facilities for the Audiology and Ophthalmology departments including state-of-the-art soundproofed booths, an eye imaging suite, a dispensing optician and other testing facilities.

story:
I am fundraising for Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity and donating the savings I'm making by staying at home during the COVID-19 crisis.  

As Great Ormond Street Hospital (GOSH) plays a role in the national response to the COVID-19 crisis by treating more children from hospitals across London, resources will become increasingly stretched.  

The hospital needs the support of Great Ormond Street Hospital Childrens Charity (GOSH Charity) now more than ever, so it can continue to deliver the best, life-saving care for seriously ill children. 

I'm donating the money I would have normally spent on a day-to-day basis. By donating what I would have spent on these small purchases, we'll be able to help the hospital through this crisis.

story:
Sometimes in life we just need to embrace the crazy and this is one of those times. I have therefore decided to do just that and raise money for my favourite charity. Deadline is 31 January (my birthday month)

*** added bonus - please - if you support me and make a donation (thank-you) - please name an RNLI station in the comments section, perhaps one you have links with, or that is close to a favourite place. The station who receives the most comments will be offered the opportunity to do the shave! ***. Deadline is 31 January

I have been in, on or around the water since a very young age, sailing, playing and swimming and for me, like many of us, the RNLI have been a stalwart presence, looking out for those of us who work or play in or on the Sea. We hope that we never need their help. There are also those who are blissfully unaware of their existence - until they are needed.

95% of their personnel are volunteers, available 24/7, 365. Lifeboats, Lifeguards, Search and Rescue, drowning prevention and much more.

This year has seen a 52% increase in incidents involving swimming alone as more people have ventured into the wonderful world of open water swimming and specifically sea swimming which has put more pressure on this organisation whilst they are impacted by a huge drop in fundraising income (re C-19).

So, please donate to this cause - whether you think I am crazy or not - they are a very worthwhile cause. Thank-you.

(travel to a Station is of course subject to C19 restrictions)

From the RNLI:

Too many people are still drowning. More than ever we need the RNLI’s help. As a charity, the RNLI depends on our donations so it can go on saving lives and keeping us and our loved ones safe. RNLI lifesavers are our lifeline. They’re the lifeboat crews who provide 24-hour search and rescue right around the UK and Ireland. The lifeguards keeping watch on 240 of the busiest beaches in the UK and Channel Islands. And the RNLI safety teams and educators working tirelessly to stop people getting into trouble in the first place.Thank you.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

This year rather than doing a secret santa and spending on shipping costs we want to offer something to the children so we are donating our Commute. 

LAST YEAR, OVER 25,000 CHILDREN ENTERING ITALY ARRIVED ALONE

There are no safe and legal routes for families to escape from the conflicts and disasters that have affected their countries. European governments simply haven’t provided them. As a result, many refugee children have been separated from their families, and left with no other options other than to rely on smugglers, who often take advantage of their desperate situation.

Authorities in Greece and Italy have found it difficult work to identify trafficked children. Children are often too scared to say anything that might put them in further danger with their smugglers. Many children travel on a “pay as you go” system, earning money to pay for themselves en route. These children often end up being exploited and used for illegal labour, including sexual exploitation.



What’s Unicef doing to help refugee children?

Together with their  partners, they've established child and family support hubs – known as Blue Dot centres – across Europe to provide help to refugee children and families.

The Blue Dot centres provide a range of services, including family reunification, child-friendly spaces, first aid, psychosocial and emotional care, legal counselling, safe spaces for women and children to sleep and outreach social workers.

The spread of coronavirus (COVID-19) has unthinkable consequences in the places CARE is already delivering lifesaving aid  places where healthcare systems are already weak, and where disaster and conflict have wiped out long-term food supplies. CARE are building on past experience responding to outbreaks of infectious disease in vulnerable communities taking particular note that emergencies, including health crises, tend to disproportionately affect women and girls.
